SEARCH
Package mz

Interface Sort<T>

Type Parameters:
T - setting of a type based on which the elements can be sorted. It is not mandatory to specify, additional pre-written subclasses specify the type.
All Known Subinterfaces:
HeapInterface<T>, InsertionInterface<T>, Intro<T>, IntroDPQ<T>, MergeInterface<T>, QuickInterface<T>, SelectionInterface<T>, SortFind<T>, SortSwap<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
Bubble, Cocktail, Comb, Counting, DoubleSelection, DualPivotQuick, Gnome, Heap, Insertion, IntroAnother, IntroBubble, IntroCocktail, IntroComb, IntroDoubleSelection, IntroDPQAnother, IntroDPQBubble, IntroDPQCocktail, IntroDPQComb, IntroDPQDoubleSelection, IntroDPQDualPivotQuick, IntroDPQGnome, IntroDPQHeap, IntroDPQInsertion, IntroDPQMerge, IntroDPQMerge3, IntroDPQMergeInPlace, IntroDPQMergeInsertion, IntroDPQOddEven, IntroDPQQuick, IntroDPQQuick3, IntroDPQSelection, IntroDPQShell, IntroDPQSmoothHeap, IntroDPQStableQuick, IntroDPQTernaryHeap, IntroDPQTim, IntroDPQWeakHeap, IntroDPQWeaveMerge, IntroDPQWiki, IntroDualPivotQuick, IntroGnome, IntroHeap, IntroInsertion, IntroMerge, IntroMerge3, IntroMergeInPlace, IntroMergeInsertion, IntroOddEven, IntroQuick, IntroQuick3, IntroSelection, IntroShell, IntroSmoothHeap, IntroStableQuick, IntroTernaryHeap, IntroTim, IntroWeakHeap, IntroWeaveMerge, IntroWiki, Merge, Merge3, MergeInPlace, MergeInsertion, OddEven, Quick, Quick3, Selection, Shell, SmoothHeap, SortComparable, SortLong, StableQuick, TernaryHeap, Tim, WeakHeap, WeaveMerge, Wiki
public interface Sort<T>
The topmost interface of the hierarchy, through which all other interface, abstract, super, sub, classes are available with polymorphism.
Since:
1.0

    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static enum 
    Sort.SortType
    You can set the desired sort by specifying sort type.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default void
    sortArray(T[] array, Sort.SortType sequence)
    Every class inherited by polymorphism will contain the callable method. default pre-created method calls additional methods.
    void
    sortArrayDec(T[] array)
    Decreasing method that inherited classes must create. its task is to arrange the elements of the array in decreasing order.
    void
    sortArrayInc(T[] array)
    Increasing method that the inherited classes have to create. its task is to arrange the elements of the array in ascending order.

  • Method Details

    • sortArray

      default void sortArray(T[] array, Sort.SortType sequence)
      Every class inherited by polymorphism will contain the callable method. default pre-created method calls additional methods. The sortArray method takes the array and the sorting sequence as parameters. It then uses a switch statement to determine the value of sequence and perform the corresponding sorting operation.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      sequence - SortType you can choose from 4 selectable queue layout types. Order can be specified here, which row arrangement you want to use.
      See Also:
      • Sort.SortType

    • sortArrayInc

      void sortArrayInc(T[] array)
      Increasing method that the inherited classes have to create. its task is to arrange the elements of the array in ascending order.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.

    • sortArrayDec

      void sortArrayDec(T[] array)
      Decreasing method that inherited classes must create. its task is to arrange the elements of the array in decreasing order.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
